preqs: A first year level unit in French studies, Film and screen studies or Literary studies

rules.ruleString: Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {ATS1061, ATS1062, ATS1276, ATS1304, ATS1305, ATS1903, ATS1904}

unitName: Representing Paris: Literature and visual culture
description: This unit, ranging across literature, painting, photography, fashion and social history, will study symbolic representations of Paris in 19th Century writing (Baudelaire, Zola), painting (Manet, Degas), and early 20th Century photography (Atget) and relate these to their historical contexts (the growth and metamorphosis of the city, Haussmann's redevelopment of Paris, the birth of leisure and consumerism); it will examine the emergence of urban figures such as the flaneur, dandy and prostitute; and it will explore the analytical perspectives offered by Walter Benjamin's cultural theories. (No knowledge of French language or history is required for this unit.)
